Sentencas: Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3- (BSCF) has won tremendous attention as a cathode material for intermediate-temperature solid-oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFC) on the basis of its fast oxygen-ion transport properties.
Titulo: Chemically Stable Perovskites as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: La-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: Nevertheless, wide application of BSCF is impeded by its phase instabilities at intermediate temperature.
Titulo: Chemically Stable Perovskites as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: La-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: Here we report on a chemically stable SOFC cathode material, La0.5Ba0.25Sr0.25Co0.8Fe0.2O3- (LBSCF), prepared by strategic approaches using the Goldschmidt tolerance factor.
Titulo: Chemically Stable Perovskites as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: La-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: The tolerance factors of LBSCF and BSCF indicate that the structure of the former has a smaller deformation of cubic symmetry than that of the latter.
Titulo: Chemically Stable Perovskites as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: La-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: The electrical property and electrochemical performance of LBSCF are improved compared with those of BSCF.
Titulo: Chemically Stable Perovskites as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: La-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: LBSCF also shows excellent chemical stability under air, a CO2-containg atmosphere, and low oxygen partial pressure while BSCF decomposed under the same conditions.
Titulo: Chemically Stable Perovskites as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: La-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ

Sentencas: Together with this excellent stability, LBSCF shows a power density of 0.81Wcm(-2) after 100h, whereas 25% degradation for BSCF is observed after 100h.
Titulo: Chemically Stable Perovskites as Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: La-Doped Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ
